summary: This document is an email chain from October 2021 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel and a contractor discussing media inquiries about the DOJ-OIG investigation into the management of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) following Jeffrey Epstein's death. It clarifies that the investigation is ongoing, not new or reopened, and focuses on institutional failures.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the death investigation and the ongoing DOJ-OIG inquiry into the management of the MCC where he died.

events.title: Media Inquiry on DOJ-OIG Investigation Activity
events.description: A contractor relays that The New York Times is hearing about recent activity/interviews in the ongoing DOJ-OIG inquiry into MCC management initiated after Epstein's death.

events.title: Clarification on Ongoing DOJ-OIG Investigation
events.description: A U.S. Attorney's Office official states the DOJ-OIG investigation into Epstein's death is ongoing, focuses on institutional failures at the MCC, and is not new.

keyFacts: As of October 2021, the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) had an ongoing investigation into the management of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) related to Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The investigation is described as focusing on 'institutional failures' and had been moving slowly since the day Epstein died.
U.S. Attorney's Office personnel explicitly state there is no 'new' investigation and that reports of it being 'reopened' are inaccurate.
Media outlets (The New York Times, CBS) were making inquiries about recent activity or interviews connected to this ongoing OIG investigation.
